---
title: "Code Gallery"
---

This page lists CoastWatch code gallery tutorials.  
Click the **eye** icon to view the tutorial or **download** to get the source file.


```{python}
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
#| message: false

import pandas as pd
from IPython.display import HTML

# CHANGE THESE IF YOU RENAME THE REPO
REPO_RAW_BASE = "https://github.com/madrichardson/CoastWatch-Training-Tutorials/raw/main/"

df = pd.read_csv("code_gallery.csv", encoding="utf-8-sig").fillna("")

# Simple, reliable inline SVGs (no newlines in the output)
EYE_SVG = (
    '<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="18" height="18" '
    'viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" '
    'stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round" aria-hidden="true">'
    '<path d="M1 12s4-8 11-8 11 8 11 8-4 8-11 8S1 12 1 12z"></path>'
    '<circle cx="12" cy="12" r="3"></circle>'
    '</svg>'
)

DOWNLOAD_SVG = (
    '<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="18" height="18" '
    'viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" '
    'stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round" aria-hidden="true">'
    '<path d="M21 15v4a2 2 0 0 1-2 2H5a2 2 0 0 1-2-2v-4"></path>'
    '<path d="M7 10l5 5 5-5"></path>'
    '<path d="M12 15V3"></path>'
    '</svg>'
)

def icon_link(url, label, svg):
    if not url:
        return '<span class="text-muted">—</span>'
    return f'<a class="cg-icon" href="{url}" aria-label="{label}">{svg}</a>'

def view_icon(path, label):
    return icon_link(path, label, EYE_SVG)

def download_icon(repo_path, label):
    if not repo_path:
        return '<span class="text-muted">—</span>'
    url = f"{REPO_RAW_BASE}{repo_path}"
    return icon_link(url, label, DOWNLOAD_SVG)

rows = []
for _, r in df.iterrows():
    rows.append({
        "Title": r["title"],
        "Category": r["category"],
        "Python": view_icon(r["py_view"], f"View Python: {r['title']}"),
        "Python ↓": download_icon(r["py_download"], f"Download Python: {r['title']}"),
        "R": view_icon(r["r_view"], f"View R: {r['title']}"),
        "R ↓": download_icon(r["r_download"], f"Download R: {r['title']}"),
    })

out = pd.DataFrame(rows)

HTML(
    out.to_html(
        index=False,
        escape=False,
        classes=["code-gallery-table"]
    )
)
```
